description: Allure is the beauty expert, an insiders’ guide to a woman’s total image, with a print audience of 5.3 million and an average monthly online audience of 13 million. Allure is the world’s most trusted voice in beauty. With vibrant imagery, rigorous reporting, and powerful storytelling, Allure is a vital guide to the trends, people, innovations, procedures, and products that matter most in makeup, skin, hair, and wellness. Allure celebrates inclusivity and drives the cultural conversation around representation, helping to expand the way society sees beauty—and the way we see ourselves. Job Description Location: New York, NY We are seeking an Associate Brand Partnerships Manager to join our team, entrusted with the task of sourcing top-tier brands and products to elevate our business. In this role, you will oversee the acquisition of new, compelling brands and products while fostering enduring relationships with existing brands. This hybrid role is located in our New York City, NY office (not fully remote). Reporting directly to the Senior Manager of Brand Partnerships. Key Responsibilities: Proactively generate leads, champion the value proposition of the Allure Beauty Box, and actively contribute to business planning. Foster and sustain relationships with key brands, aiding them in achieving their goals while formulating a sustainable, long-term business strategy for consistent campaigns. Discover emerging brands and trending products, securing exclusive items and presenting them internally for potential inclusion in upcoming campaigns. Negotiate competitive costs, contract terms, and product offerings to fortify the overall growth strategy. Continuously educate brands about the latest product offerings from Allure Beauty Box. Serve as the internal brand ambassador, contributing to defining the brand's vision, goals, and positioning in Allure Beauty Box campaigns. Recognize prevalent brand preferences during the curation process to assist in the development of future initiatives. Attend industry and company events, and engage in marketing production as necessary. Qualifications: Minimum of 1-2 years' experience in account management, buying, or merchandising within the beauty industry. Demonstrated analytical and business-oriented approach to meet financial targets. Proficient in negotiating with vendors and brands to secure optimal costs. Exceptionally organized and goal-driven, adept at managing competing priorities and accounts. Outstanding verbal and written communication skills, externally with contacts and internally with team members and leadership. Comfortable presenting to both external and internal clients, consistently achieving monthly goals. Self-directed work style with a strong inclination towards collaboration, urgency, creativity, and results. Bachelor's degree. Passion for the beauty industry. Preferred Qualifications: Experience in merchandising/buying within the beauty industry. Existing relationships with brands in the industry. Base Salary: $60,000 - $75,000 What happens next? If you are interested in this opportunity, please apply below, and we will review your application as soon as possible. You can update your resume or upload a cover letter at any time by accessing your candidate profile. Condé Nast is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, familial status and other legally protected characteristics. Condé Nast is a global media company home to iconic brands including Vogue, GQ, AD, Condé Nast Traveler, Vanity Fair, Wired, The New Yorker, Glamour, Allure, Bon Appétit, Self and many more. Headquartered in New York and London, the company produces award-winning journalism, content and entertainment for every platform today and operates in 32 markets worldwide including China, France, Germany, India, Italy, Japan, Mexico, Spain, the U.K. and U.S., and Taiwan. At Condé Nast we value diversity of background, views and cultures. We celebrate people for their personal qualities, their skills and contributions. And we recognize the power our brands have to influence and shape culture, catalyze action and help make our world a better place for all. For more information, please visit condenast.com and follow @CondeNast and @CondeNastCareer for Twitter and @condenastcareers for Instagram.
